edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm

Class ActiveMQCommunicationSetup

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm.QueueCommunicationSetup
      • edu.biu.scapi.comm.twoPartyComm.ActiveMQCommunicationSetup
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TwoPartyCommunicationSetup, org.apache.commons.exec.TimeoutObserver

    public class ActiveMQCommunicationSetup
extends QueueCommunicationSetup
    This class is an example of QueueCommunicationSetup that uses the ActiveMQ implementation of the JMS. The constructor of this class create the ActiveMQ connection factory and the ActiveMQDestroyer and pass it to the constructor of the QueueCommunicationSetup to work with.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ActiveMQCommunicationSetup.ActiveMQDestroyer
      A class that delete the ActiveMQ destinations using the ActiveMQ connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ActiveMQCommunicationSetup

        public ActiveMQCommunicationSetup(java.lang.String url,
                          PartyData me,
                          PartyData party)
                           throws DuplicatePartyException
        Sets the parties parameters and create the communication using the given url.

        In case you use this constructor, Nagles algorithm is disabled; for cryptographic protocols this is typically much better.

        Parameters:
        url - The url of the ActiveMQ broker.
        me - Data of the current application.
        party - Data of the other application.
        Throws:
        DuplicatePartyException

      • ActiveMQCommunicationSetup

        public ActiveMQCommunicationSetup(java.lang.String url,
                          PartyData me,
                          PartyData party,
                          boolean enableNagle)
                           throws DuplicatePartyException
        Sets the parties parameters and create the communication using the given url.

        Note that using this function you can choose to use or not to use the Nagle algorithm.

        Parameters:
        url - The url of the ActiveMQ broker.
        me - Data of the current application.
        party - Data of the other application.
        enableNagle - Indicates if to use Nagle's algorithm or not. For cryptographic algorithms it is much better to disable Nagle's algorithm.
        Throws:
        DuplicatePartyException
